pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the n8n-runners-custom repository, explaining its purpose as a tool for building customized n8n runner Docker images with Python dependencies

pages.title: Quick Start Guide
pages.purpose: Provide step-by-step instructions for forking the repo, customizing requirements.txt, triggering the build workflow, and deploying the resulting image

pages.title: Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain the high-level system architecture, including how configuration files, build processes, and runtime components interact

pages.title: Task Runner Configuration System
pages.purpose: Detail how n8n-task-runners.json defines JavaScript and Python runner execution environments, including commands, arguments, and security settings

pages.title: Build Pipeline Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain the GitHub Actions workflow that orchestrates Docker image building, including triggers, inputs, and publishing to GHCR

pages.title: Runtime Image Structure
pages.purpose: Describe the file system layout, installed components, and runtime configuration within the custom runner Docker image

pages.title: Configuration Reference
pages.purpose: Provide comprehensive reference documentation for all configuration files used to customize runner behavior and build process

pages.title: Task Runner Configuration (n8n-task-runners.json)
pages.purpose: Document all fields in n8n-task-runners.json including runner-type, command, args, health-check-server-port, allowed-env, and env-overrides

pages.title: Python Dependencies (requirements.txt)
pages.purpose: Explain how to specify Python packages in requirements.txt, including version pinning syntax and best practices

pages.title: Build Workflow Configuration
pages.purpose: Document the GitHub Actions workflow inputs (n8n_version, tag_name), triggers, and build steps

pages.title: Dockerfile Reference
pages.purpose: Explain the Dockerfile structure, base image selection, dependency installation process, and user privilege model

pages.title: Security Guide
pages.purpose: Cover security considerations for both JavaScript and Python runners, including permission models and environment variable filtering

pages.title: JavaScript Runtime Security
pages.purpose: Detail the restrictive security model for JavaScript runners including code generation restrictions, prototype pollution prevention, and empty allow lists

pages.title: Python Runtime Security
pages.purpose: Explain the permissive Python runner security model with wildcard permissions and discuss multi-user deployment risks

pages.title: Environment Variable Security
pages.purpose: Document the environment variable whitelisting and override mechanisms that control what variables reach runner processes

pages.title: Operations Guide
pages.purpose: Provide operational guidance for building, deploying, and monitoring custom n8n runner images in production

pages.title: Building Custom Images
pages.purpose: Walk through the complete process of customizing and building runner images, from forking to deploying

pages.title: Health Monitoring
pages.purpose: Explain the health check server architecture, ports, and how to monitor runner availability and status

pages.title: Advanced Topics
pages.purpose: Cover advanced customization scenarios, limitations, and troubleshooting for power users

pages.title: JavaScript Dependency Customization
pages.purpose: Discuss the current limitations of JavaScript package installation and the disabled uuid/moment code in the Dockerfile

pages.title: Multi-User Deployment
pages.purpose: Address security considerations and authorization concerns when deploying custom runners in multi-user n8n instances

pages.title: Troubleshooting
pages.purpose: Provide solutions for common issues with building, deploying, and running custom n8n runner images

pages.title: Reference
pages.purpose: Provide quick reference tables and lists for environment variables, ports, and licensing information

pages.title: Environment Variables
pages.purpose: List all environment variables used by JavaScript and Python runners, including their purposes and allowed values

pages.title: Ports and Endpoints
pages.purpose: Document the health check server ports (5681 for JavaScript, 5682 for Python) and their purposes

pages.title: License
pages.purpose: Present the MIT license terms under which the n8n-runners-custom project is distributed
